content: #335 7 brickyard ln ridges hat designed by susan vaiciulis no such thing as bad weather only bad clothes a close-fitting warm hat can make the worst winter weather feel like a walk in the park the purl ridges on this lushly textured hat knit with dense bulky yarn trap warmth and can keep your noggin toasty even in the depth of a cold snap size 21 5 / 54 5cm circumference unstretched gauge 10 sts per 4 /10 cm for accuracy check gauge and adjust needle size if necessary yarn 1 skein merino bulky needles us size 10 5 & 13 16 circulars & dpn s glossary k2 decrease = knit two sts together as one st decrease kfb = knit into the front of the st and the back of the st increase purl 2tog = purl 2 sts together as one decrease instructions with 16 /40 cm us size 10 5 cast on 60 sts join into a round and work garter st knit one round purl one round until you have 3 ridges on the right side on next round increase as follows * k2 kfb rept from * 80 sts change to larger neede us size 13 and start working the following stitch pattern round 1 - knit around 80 sts round 2 - purl 2tog around 40 sts round 3 - kfb in each st 80 sts repeat these 3 rounds until the hat measures 5 5/14 cm to 6 / 15 cm from cast on edge 7 ridges having just completed a round 2 40 sts change to smaller us size 10 5 needles for crown decreases round 1 - * k6 k2tog rept from * around 35 sts round 2 4 & 6 - knit all the sts round 3 - * k5 k2tog rept from * around 30 sts round 5 - * k4 k2tog rept from * around 25 sts round 7 - * k3 k2tog rept from * around 20 sts 1 round 8 - * k2 k2tog rept from * around 15 sts round 9 - * k1 k2tog rept from * around 10 sts round 10 - * k2tog rept from * around 5 sts cut yarn about 12 / 30 cm long thread needle through all sts twice pull tight and fasten_off finishing weave in loose ends on wrong side of work your garment will be softer and more beautiful after hand-washing in warm water with a mild soap or detergent rinse in warm water then roll in a towel to remove excess moisture or spin dry in a washing machine for 10 seconds only lay flat to dry in a well-ventilated area shaping to correct measurements block if necessary green mountain spinnery 7 brickyard ln putney vermont 05346-0568 phone 802 387 4528 fax 802 387 4841 email spinnery@spinnery com ©copyright green mountain spinnery increase 2025 2
